jobDescription: Job Description What you'll be doing...  Verizon is seeking a Principal Data Scientist that will be responsible for solving technical challenges and problems for various Verizon and Oath businesses using data science and analytical models. This role reports directly to the Director of Data Science. This position will:  Design, develop, validate, and deploy analytical (predictive, optimization) models and solutions using machine learning and statistical modeling on a big data platform.  Guiding a group of junior and senior data scientists with the best practices of software engineering, to address multifaceted technical and business problems.  Understanding the trade-offs among the various machine learning algorithms (existing and emerging) and making the right choice that serves the business objectives.  Designing machine learning models and evaluation pipelines for production systems.  Effectively communicating and collaborating within and across teams.  Lead internal projects to use data science to solve various business challenges.  This person will be considered a Data Science SME.  What we're looking for... You'll need to have:Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience.Six or more years of relevant work experience.Even better if you have:PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or Physics.Experience with various machine learning algorithms for classification and regression, strong understanding of advantages and drawbacks of each of them.Strong experience in using Spark, Hadoop, or other MapReduce-based computing framework for massive datasets.Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, or Java.Strong visualization skills to make data-driven insights easy to understand for various teams.Strong computer science fundamental concepts such as data structures and algorithms design.Solid foundation in applied mathematics, such as: statistics, linear algebra, and optimization.Experience dealing with massive geolocated or internet browsing data.Publications in data science and machine learning conferences and journals.Previously implemented and deployed deep learning models.Five or more years of data science and machine learning experience.Detail oriented, curious, excellent quantitative, written, and oral communication skills. When you join Verizon...  You'll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America's fastest and most reliable network, we're leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we're about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.  Equal Employment Opportunity  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.
